basics.name: Fabio D. Argañaraz
basics.label: Full Stack Developer | Computer Science Teacher
basics.summary: Experienced Full Stack Developer with 5 years of web development experience and 8 years of teaching in informatics.

work.name: ADA School
work.summary: Teaching full-stack development with a focus on Java, Spring Boot, H2, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL to students in a remote learning environment.
highlights: Remote teaching for Full Stack Development.
Instruction on Java, Spring Boot, H2, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL technologies.
Use of modern tools and technologies in full-stack education.

work.name: Universidad Nacional de Tres de Febrero
work.summary: Creation of didactic material and practical exercises, evaluation and monitoring of student progress in modern web technologies.
highlights: Developed course materials and practical exercises on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express, MongoDB, SQL, MySQL, and JWT.
Provided comprehensive instruction on building and securing web applications using modern technologies.

work.name: DigitalMind
work.summary: Creation of didactic material and practical exercises, monitoring students' progress in frontend and backend web development.
highlights: Developed course materials and practical exercises on React for frontend development.
Taught backend development using PHP, Laravel, and version control systems.
Provided comprehensive instruction on integrating frontend and backend technologies to build robust web applications.

work.name: Ledesma
work.position: Professor - Introduction to Computer Science as a Management Tool
work.summary: Part of the Ledesma Innovation and Technology Program in collaboration with the National University of Jujuy.
highlights: User Interfaces: Ways we can interact with our devices.
Version Control: How teams collaborate and manage code in software development.
Hardware: What are the physical components of a computer.
Networks: How devices communicate with the hardware of our systems.

work.name: Universidad Católica de Santiago del Estero
work.position: Professor - Full Stack Web Programming MERN, Models and Simulation, Computer Science, Fundamentals of AI
work.summary: Head Professor of Practical Works in Models and Simulation for the Computer Engineering program.
highlights: Led the development and implementation of the Full Stack Web Programming curriculum using the MERN stack.
Supervised and guided students in building practical applications based on MERN stack principles.
Designed and delivered AI-based course material for the Computer Science program.
Facilitated simulation-based learning in the Models and Simulation course, allowing students to solve real-world engineering problems.
Mentored students in the Fundamentals of AI, introducing them to machine learning algorithms and neural networks.

work.name: Next U
work.summary: Seasonal professor in Full Stack Development.
highlights: Taught Full Stack web development with a focus on Java, Spring Boot, and React.
Guided students in building RESTful APIs using Spring Boot, with integrations to PostgreSQL and MySQL databases.
Led students in developing dynamic frontend applications using React, focusing on component-based architecture and state management.
Developed hands-on projects where students built full-stack applications, integrating React on the frontend and Spring Boot on the backend.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Completed multiple freelance projects on platforms such as Upwork, Fiverr, and PeoplePerHour.
highlights: Developed an Internal Management App for personnel shift control, integrating user validation and MongoDB for database management, with a React-based front-end and unit testing using Jest.
Collaborated on a Handmade Products Start-up, handling requirement analysis, front-end development with React and Typescript, and back-end development using Node.js for inventory management.
Built an Internal Control App for shift and server management, featuring real-time queries and error monitoring, with a React and Typescript front-end, and Node.js and MongoDB back-end.
Contributed to the development of an Animal Shelters App, creating the front-end using React, Redux, and Typescript, and designing the back-end with PostgreSQL for database management.

work.name: Digital House
work.summary: Professor for the Certified Tech Developer program in collaboration with Mercado Libre and Globant.
highlights: Taught fundamental soft and technical skills for disruptive companies.

work.name: Faculty of Engineering - UNJu
work.position: Professor - Introduction to Computer Science, Database I, Database II, Programming Methodology
work.summary: Professor of various subjects for the Computer Engineering program at the National University of Jujuy.
highlights: Courses focused on programming methodologies and databases.

work.name: UNICEF Argentina
work.summary: Technological Referent for the Ministry of Education of Jujuy, in collaboration with UNICEF for rural secondary schools.
highlights: Coordinated technical teams, maintained networks, and provided training for students and teachers.

work.name: Plan 111 Mil
work.summary: Instructor for modules on programming techniques, object-oriented programming, databases, and software development.
highlights: Taught programming with Java, MySQL, and PseInt.

awards.title: Top GPA Medal
awards.summary: Award for achieving the highest GPA in the Informatics Engineering degree.

certificates.name: Introduction to Agile Project Management with Azure DevOps

projects.name: Semiyuda
projects.description: A platform for users to donate and receive food, and manage seed planting for home gardening.
highlights: User registration with email or phone number, including account verification and KYC.
Seed kit request with delivery address and order tracking.
Food donation functionality with quantity indication and photo upload, plus a reward system for donations.
Food request and receipt for users in need with eligibility verification.
Instant messaging for communication between users and organizations.
Geolocation and mapping integration for efficient food delivery and tracking.
Reports and statistics on app performance and impact.

projects.name: Preservation Animal
projects.description: Wildlife Preservation Platform in Latin America.
highlights: Developed a comprehensive platform for biodiversity conservation in Latin America.
Implemented an e-commerce system for selling exclusive merchandise, with contributions directly supporting conservation projects.
Developed features for direct donations and volunteering opportunities.
Created a user portal for managing products, tracking transactions, and receiving notifications.
Utilized advanced technologies such as React, Vite, TailwindCSS, and Formik for a smooth and modern user experience.

projects.name: Henry-Bank
highlights: Developed a scalable backend using Node.js and microservices architecture.
Integrated with third-party APIs for payment processing and user authentication.
Built a responsive mobile front-end with React Native, ensuring cross-platform compatibility.
Optimized database queries, reducing load times by 30%.
Implemented secure transaction protocols and JWT-based user authentication.
Collaborated with a team of 4 developers using Agile methodologies.
